name: Diclofenac Potassium

indications.text: diclofenac potassium indicated relief mild moderate acute pain adult pediatric patients 12 years age older .

contraindications.text: lowest effective shortest duration consistent individual patient treatment goals ( 2.1 ) 25 mg four times day

warningsAndPrecautions: diclofenac potassium 25 mg , translucent , pale yellow , liquid-filled capsules printed “ x592 ” black ink supplied : bottles 120 capsules ndc # 69315-275-20. storagestore room temperature 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15°c 30°c ( 59°f 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . protect moisture dispense tight container ( usp ) .
adverseReactions: diclofenac potassium contraindicated following patients : known hypersensitivity ( e.g . , anaphylactic serious skin ) diclofenac components product [ ( 5.7 , 5.9 ) ] history asthma , urticaria , allergic-type taking aspirin nsaids . severe , sometimes fatal , anaphylactic nsaids reported patients [ ( 5.7 , 5.8 ) ] setting coronary artery bypass graft ( cabg ) surgery [ ( 5.1 ) ] diclofenac potassium contains gelatin contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity bovine protein .
indications_original: Diclofenac Potassium is indicated for relief of mild to moderate acute pain in adult and pediatric patients 12 years of age and older.
contraindications_original: Use the lowest effective dosage for shortest duration consistent with individual patient treatment goals ( 2.1) The dosage is 25 mg four times a day
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Diclofenac Potassium 25 mg, are translucent, pale yellow, liquid-filled capsules printed with “X592” in black ink supplied as:Bottles of 120 Capsules NDC# 69315-275-20.
                  StorageStore at room temperature 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F); excursions permitted between 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F)[see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Protect from moisture
                  Dispense in tight container (USP).
adverseReactions_original:
Diclofenac Potassium is contraindicated in the following patients:
                  
                     Known hypersensitivity (e.g., anaphylactic reactions and serious skin reactions) to diclofenac or any components of the drug product [see Warnings and Precautions (5.7, 5.9)]
                     
                     History of asthma, urticaria, or other allergic-type reactions after taking aspirin or other NSAIDs. Severe, sometimes fatal, anaphylactic reactions to NSAIDs have been reported in such patients [see Warnings and Precautions (5.7, 5.8)]
                     
                     In the setting of coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery [see Warnings and Precautions (5.1)]
                     
                     Diclofenac Potassium contains gelatin and is contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to bovine protein.
